Data: Australia must have been eyeing a score of well above 400 after that opening stand but lost their way badly, particularly today. They lost their last six wickets for just 23 - and their last five for just 4 - as the South African seamers tore away at them, troubling their batsmen especially with the short ball. The pitch has helped the bowlers today so Johnson and Hilfenhaus will bank on some assistance.
Johnson to Kallis, no run short of a length outside off, Kallis thinks of playing it but withdraws from the shot at the last moment

Johnson to Kallis, 4 leg byes short outside leg, hits him on his hips to beat the diving Haddin, Hilfenhaus dives full length to his right at fine leg but he was in contact with the ropes just as he pushed the ball back in
Johnson to Kallis, no run oooh, short again and hit him on the gloves to land just short of gully, he was trying to play it to the leg side but the ball moved away
Johnson to Kallis, no run gets back and defends it well into the off side
Johnson to Kallis, no run stands tall and defends to point, short outside off again
Johnson to Kallis, no run good length outside off, going away with the angle, left alone to the keeper
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run back of a length on the off stump, defended back to Hilfy
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run pushing him back again, lands on a good length on middle, defended solidly onto the pitch
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run bouncer banged in on middle, Duminy ducks under it well in the end, albeit a little awkwardly
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run fuller on middle and leg, turned away to square leg
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run short of a length outside off, excellent bounce here for the bowlers, he prods at it off the back foot but is beaten by the time he decides to withdraw
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, FOUR runs erring in length and Duminy cashes in, its on the pads and clips it away through the midwicket region, stylishly played
Johnson to Kallis, no run full outside off, gets forward and pushes it firmly to mid-off
Johnson to Kallis, no run short of a good length outside off, held its line there, shoulders arms
Johnson to Kallis, no run full on the off stump, pushed through the line to mid-off again
Johnson to Kallis, no run bouncer banged in short at 148.7 kmph outside off, Kallis backs away from it, though a little too late as he had initially shaped up to defend it
Johnson to Kallis, FOUR runs back of a length again, plays it well this time, gets back, opens the face t beat the gap between point and gully
Johnson to Kallis, no run short of a length outside off, tries to pull it away through midwicket, ends up getting an inside edge onto his pads
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run short outside off, Duminy lets it go

Hilfenhaus to Duminy, FOUR runs safe shot as there are plent of vacant areas on the leg side, short outside off, he pulls it away in the direction of deep square leg, mistimed it but had enough to have it roll over the ropes
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run attempted bouncer, landed short outside off, left alone
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run on a good length on middle and off, dropped short of cover
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run he anticipated that and played it very well, bouncer on middle and he's quick on his feet to duck under it
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run well played, on middle and leg, pushed wide of short leg for a single
Johnson to Duminy, no run targeting the body, though with no malicious intent, leaps up after landing short on leg stump, hits him on his glove as he tries to defend it on the leg side
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a length outside off, left alone to the keeper
Johnson to Duminy, no run back of a length, defended firmly to cover off the back foot
Johnson to Duminy, FOUR runs excellent stuff, fractionally short on the off stump, picks the length early and pulls it away behind square, rolled his wrists over it nicely, he's looked good here
Johnson to Duminy, no run held its line this time, much fuller on leg stump, Duminy tries to work it away fine but is hit high on the pads
Johnson to Duminy, no run missed opportunity there, fuller on leg stump, going down with the angle, tries to turn it away fine but is struck on the pads again
McDonald to Kallis, no run full on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
McDonald to Kallis, no run driven off the front foot to mid-off
McDonald to Kallis, no run short of a good length on middle and off, defended back to the bowler
McDonald to Kallis, no run overpitched on the off stump, pushed firmly to mid-off
McDonald to Kallis, 1 run good length on leg stump, driven wide of mid-on for a single
McDonald to Duminy, no run full on middle and off, played confidently to mid-off
Siddle to Kallis, no run beaten straightaway! Short of a good length outside off, bowled at 141.2 kmph, Kallis plays inside the line to that one, it moves away to beat the outside edge
Siddle to Kallis, no run full on the off stump, driven off the front foot straight to mid-off
Siddle to Kallis, no run cut back in, good length outside off and Kallis read the bounce well to let it go, well over the stumps
Siddle to Kallis, no run the bounce almost had him this time but he did a good job taking his bottom hand off, landed on a good length on the off and just leapt
Siddle to Kallis, no run kept low this time, Siddle gets it to move back in from middle, Kallis got his bat down just in time, it took the inside edge, onto his pads
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a length outside off and moving away this time, shoulders arms to that one
McDonald to Duminy, no run meaty length ball outide off, driven firmly through the line to mid-off
McDonald to Duminy, no run full, almost yorker length, bowled at 124.6 kmph on the off stump, dug out to the bowler
McDonald to Duminy, no run good length outside off and cut away off the pitch, left alone
McDonald to Duminy, no run fuller, teasing line outside the off stump, left alone
McDonald to Duminy, no run outside the off stump, lands on a good lengt, no movement, left alone
McDonald to Duminy, no run leaning into the drive there, full outside off and played straight to cover
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a good length on the off stump, defended off the back foot to cover
Siddle to Kallis, no run swinging in, defended well off the back foot, one of his quicker deliveries, bowled at 147.2 kmph
Siddle to Kallis, no run moved away this time but Kallis covered it well, got back and guided it to gully
Siddle to Kallis, no run fuller on middle and off, defended solidly off the front foot
Siddle to Kallis, no run back of a length outside off, chops it down to point
Siddle to Kallis, no run bowled on a good length outside off, left alone to the keeper
McDonald to Duminy, no run full outside off stump, gets forward and drives it straight to cover
McDonald to Duminy, no run full on middle and off, gets across and defends it with a full face to mid-on
McDonald to Duminy, no run short of a good length on the off stump, defended solidly short of cover
McDonald to Duminy, 1 leg bye short outside leg, tries to turn it away behind square, gets a leg bye instead
McDonald to Kallis, no run back of a length on the off stump, blocked towards cover
McDonald to Kallis, FOUR runs just a fraction full outside off, stays his ground and drives it imperiously through the covers, seized on the length quickly there
Siddle to Duminy, no run fuller on the off stump, mistimes a drive to mid-off
Siddle to Duminy, no run short of a length on the off stump and cuts in, defended a little awkwardly off the back foot
Siddle to Duminy, 1 bye calls it a bye but there seemed to be a deflection, short on middle, jumps up to work it away on the leg side, probably clipped his trousers to beat a diving Haddin
Siddle to Kallis, no run back of a length on the off stump, defended off the back foot towards point
Siddle to Kallis, no run and again, pushes it in front of point this time
Siddle to Kallis, no run banged in short on middle, Kallis ducks under it well
McDonald to Duminy, 1 run on middle and off, turned away wide of midwicket for a single
McDonald to Kallis, no run full outside off, Kallis ignores it
McDonald to Kallis, FOUR runs not this time though, tries to square drive it past point but ends up getting a thick edge to beat a diving gully
McDonald to Kallis, no run overpitched on middle, driven straight to midwicket
McDonald to Kallis, no run wow, bowled from wide of the crease angling into the batsman and cut away sharply as Kallis tried to defend that off the back foot, beaten
McDonald to Kallis, no run short again but no movement this time, left alone
Siddle to Duminy, no run short of a length on middle and leg, tries to turn it away off the back foot, is hit high on the pads
Siddle to Duminy, no run on middle and leg, defended off the back foot towards midwicket
Siddle to Duminy, 1 run turns it away off the front foot behind square, hit hard on the gloves actually
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a good length on leg stump, fends it away wide of short leg
Siddle to Kallis, no run back of a length on the off stump and cut back in, working up some good pace here our good friend Siddle, bowled at 147 kmph

Siddle to Kallis, no run good length on middle and off, gets on the back foot and blocks it dead on the off side, tough bloke this Kallis, has taken a few blows but has done well fight it out this session
McDonald to Duminy, no run angling in from round the wicket, moved away after pitching, defended to cover
McDonald to Duminy, no run full on leg stump, could have glanced it fine but plays it in front of square instead, towards midwicket
McDonald to Duminy, no run slightly short, gets back and drops it towards the same fielder
McDonald to Duminy, no run fuller on middle and off, defended off the front foot into the leg side
McDonald to Duminy, FOUR runs short of a length outside off, gets back and cuts it away between gully and point for a welcome boundary
McDonald to Duminy, no run fuller on middle, pushed back to McDonald, they've handled him fairly easily here

Siddle to Kallis, no run angling in from wide of the crease, Kallis, after having faced a series of short balls from Siddle gets on the back foot but the bowler pushes it full, defended well in the end but he shouldn't be playing back to a length ball
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a length on middle, defended into the off side
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a length, closer to the off stump, left alone
Siddle to Kallis, no run back of a length on the off stump, defended watchfully into the off side
Siddle to Kallis, no run short of a good length outside off and cut back in, Kallis let it go
Siddle to Kallis, FOUR runs overpitched on middle and leg and he dismissed it, played a beautiful on-drive wide of mid-on and the ball raced away
North to Duminy, no run short of a length outside off, spinning away, left alone
North to Duminy, no run lunges forward to defend on the front foot
North to Duminy, no run short outside off, spins away, Duminy lets it go
North to Duminy, no run tossed up on middle and off, defended to cover
North to Duminy, no run flighted, full outside off, driven crisply to cover
North to Duminy, no run tossed up on middle, reaches forward to defend it back to the bowler
Johnson to Kallis, no run short of a good length on middle, defended off the back foot to mid-on
Johnson to Kallis, no run held it back again, pushed to cover
Johnson to Kallis, no run on the back foot again, bowled a touch fuller, blocked into the off side
Johnson to Kallis, no run lands on a good length on middle and zips off the pitch to strike Kallis on the front glove for the umpteenth time, he's survived well so far

Johnson to Kallis, no run do we have another injury here, not a pretty sight! Short on middle, struck Kallis on the jaw from under the helmet, he's in pain and is bleeding, the physio is out and it may take some time before he's back on his feet. Lethal delivery that.
Johnson to Boucher, no run short on leg stump, misdirected bouncer that, he ducks under it comfortably
North to Duminy, 1 run pushed wide of coverfor a single
North to Boucher, no run flighted outside off, lands full, pushed to cover
North to Boucher, 1 run gets forward and turns it away into the leg side
North to Duminy, no run tossed up on middle and off, lunges forward and drops it dead short of cover
North to Duminy, FOUR runs there to hit, full on the off stump, leans into the drive to place that perfectly between cover and mid-off
North to Duminy, no run pushed through quick on the off stump, gets forward and opens the face to guide it to point
Johnson to Boucher, no run short on middle, tries to turn it behind square, gets an inside edge onto his thighs, lobs up but falls short of short leg
Johnson to Boucher, no run 147.2 kmph, bouncer outside leg stump, had Boucher dancing

Johnson to Boucher, no run beaten this time! Short of a length on the off stump and moved away off the pitch, he tried to defend that off the back foot but the movement caused it to zip past the outside edge
Johnson to Boucher, no run bouncer on middle and Boucher is quick on his feet this time, evades it well
Johnson to Boucher, no run good length on middle, defended off the back foot to the bowler
Siddle to Duminy, no run full outside off, opens the face to steer it to point
Siddle to Duminy, no run good length on and outside off, tries to defend off the back foot, gets a thick outside edge towards point
Siddle to Duminy, 1 run short of a good length on middle, pushed wide of midwicket
Siddle to Harris, no run short on the off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
Siddle to Harris, no run banged in again on middle, Harris tries to duck but is struck on the shoulder
Siddle to Harris, no run defended off the back foot towards point
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run Bowled full on middle and off, driven off the front foot wide of cover for a single
Johnson to Harris, no run short of a good length on the off stump, gets back, opens the face and guides it to point
Johnson to Harris, 1 run short on middle, pushed off the back foot wide of short leg for a single
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run held it back again dropped in short outside off, drags it wide of short leg for another run

Johnson to Harris, no run short down the leg side, gets on the back foot and tries to turn it away behind square, goes through to the keeper and the fielders seem to think there was a faint tickle. The umpire says no and they've called for a referral. Replays indicate it brushed his shirt on the way to Haddin, not out
Johnson to Harris, no run short of a good length on the off stump, gets back and drops it dead on the off side
Siddle to Duminy, 1 run short on leg stump, tries to tuck it away behind square, is hit on the thighs

Siddle to Harris, no run swung back in, bowled a barrage of short ones and followed that up with one bowled really full, Harris is on the back foot, he defends it well in the end, got his bat down just in time
Siddle to Harris, no run short one on middle and went down leg, Harris lets that go
Siddle to Harris, no run kept a little low there but he played it well, short of a length on the off stump and moved in after pitching, played back to the bowler
Siddle to Harris, no run full outside off, bowled at 138.8 kmph, Harris leaves it alone and it gets to the keeper after bouncing twice
Siddle to Harris, no run bouncer banged in outside off, left alone to the keeper, Harris has done a good job so far amid some unforgiving bowling
Johnson to Duminy, no run straying on the pads, full on the leg stump and going down further, tries to glance that fine but it's a little too wide

Johnson to Duminy, FOUR runs Duminy is the last bastion now for South Africa and he's done a stellar job so far, fraction full on middle and leg, drives it through the line all along the ground in the vacant mid-on region
Johnson to Duminy, no run good length on middle and off, pushed into the off side off the back foot
Johnson to Duminy, FOUR runs shot! Short outside off and he pulls it away in front of square, there's cover in the deep but the fielder there has no chance, sped away
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a length outside off, gets on the back foot to chop it wide of gully, Hussey flings himself to his left to prevent a certain four
Johnson to Duminy, no run full on middle and off, defended solidly back to the bowler
Hilfenhaus to Harris, 1 run short of a good length on the off stump, pushed off the back foot wide of short leg for a single
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run straying on the pads, turned away to fine leg for a single
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run short of a good length on the off stump, kept a little low but he negotiated it well, keeping his backlift low and defending it towards cover
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run good length just outside off, Harris hops back and defends
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run again he hops back and defends
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run pitched up on the stumps and he plays it of the back foot
Johnson to Duminy, no run pitches it up a foot outside off stump and no shot offered
Johnson to Duminy, no run overpitched and Duminy drives confidently but right to cover
Johnson to Duminy, FOUR runs overpitched again and this time he leans into the half-volley, driving it into the window between the covers to pick up a classy boundary
Johnson to Duminy, no run holds back the length and Duminy shuffles around to pat it back
Johnson to Duminy, 4 byes bad ball, just cannot control the swing and sprays it three feet down the leg stumps, Haddin has to leap around and fumbles
Johnson to Duminy, no run pitched up and he defends it back this time
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run pitched up in search of the yorker but Harris digs it rather well
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run deadly straight on the stumps and Harris gets in line to defend
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run a touch fuller and straighter and he picks it off his pads
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run back of a length on off stump, hops back and pushes to point
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run again Harris jumps back and pushes at it, edging down to gully
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run fuller on middle and off, Harris shuffles and clips to square leg
Siddle to Duminy, no run starts off with one way down the leg stump and Haddin collects
Siddle to Duminy, no run short ball on leg stump, forcing Duminy to rise and play it down safely
Siddle to Duminy, no run angles across off a length and he squeezes it to backward point
Siddle to Duminy, 1 leg bye pitches down leg stump, short of a length, and Duminy hops up to try and swat it away but the ball brushes his pads and slips down toward short fine leg
Siddle to Harris, no run back of a length outside off stump and Harris defends to cover
Siddle to Harris, no run pitched up wide of off stump outside off and no shot offered
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, (no ball) pitched up on off stump and he gets in line to defend solidly
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 2 runs short on the pads and swatted through square leg out to Siddle
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run again on the pads and Duminy nudges it through midwicket for one
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run pitches on a length, off stump, and Harris jumps in line to block
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run now he tests him with a short one down the stumps, Harris flinches and takes his eyes out of the way but most important is that he's got the hands well out of the way
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run another nasty one, short outside off stump this time, Harris again loses sight of it and the ball brushes his left shoulder and balloons up, that will leave a red mark
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run ends the over with a full one, on the stumps, but Harris shuffles and just manages to keep it out
Siddle to Duminy, FOUR runs pitches it outside leg stump, seams it across Duminy, who pushes at it and gets an outside edge along the ground between slips and gully and thats a good fifty
Siddle to Duminy, no run short ball, but he gets up and behind the ball to defend solidly
Siddle to Duminy, no run pitches it across him and he shoulders arms
Siddle to Duminy, 2 runs back of a length and he gets across and defends, running it fine
Siddle to Duminy, no run sprays it down the leg stump and Haddin takes
Siddle to Duminy, no run half-volley outside leg stump, Duminy misses out on the flick
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run short and seaming away outside off and he just leaves in time
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run ripper! Pace and bounce, just back of a length but it spits up off the track and rears past Harris, jumping up, and again he just manages to withdraw the bat in time
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run gets up and fends at another short one, running it down to gully
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run very, very full and the bat comes down in time to jam it out
Hilfenhaus to Harris, 1 run short on the stumps and fended at, just wide of short leg for one
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run bouncer over the stumps and Duminy sways out of the way
Siddle to Harris, no run pitched up in search of the yorker but very well played by Harris
Siddle to Harris, no run pitched up outside off stump and he defends it back
Siddle to Harris, no run banged in short and he ducks under the ball
Siddle to Harris, no run short outside off stump, Harris gets tall and leaves it alone
Siddle to Harris, no run pitches it up, gets some swing back to Harris, who doesn't move his feet much but again brings the straight bat down in time, keeping the ball out to short leg
Siddle to Harris, no run swings up a yorker just outside off stump, it dips and just beats the bat as Harris tries to jam it out, then it rolls down toward Haddin

Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 2 runs banged in short and Duminy goes for the hook but mistimes it and the balls up in the air for a long time, a real miscue but it drops into no man's land well wide of fine leg
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 2 runs drops it short and he pulls in front of square to raise the 100
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run back of a length and angling across, Duminy shoulders arms
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, no run and again, about two feet outside off and he shoulders arms
Hilfenhaus to Duminy, 1 run reaches out and pushes the wide half-volley to the cover sweeper
Hilfenhaus to Harris, no run bangs it in short again and Harris ducks out of it

Siddle to Duminy, no run massive appeal from Siddle, it's sliding down leg, Duminy tries to glance it fine, misses, and the bowler is absolutely convinced, while his team-mates are not. They've decided against the referral,rightly so, it came off the thigh pad
Siddle to Duminy, no run full on middle and off, moving back in, defended to cover
Siddle to Duminy, 1 run full on the pads, clipped to deep midwicket for a single, Harris, who has impressed here with his determined effort, will now face
Siddle to Harris, 1 run pushed uppishly off the back foot wide of short leg, short of a length on the off stump and he swats it on the leg side
Siddle to Duminy, no run good length on the off stump, driven stylishly but straight to cover, Duminy has looked good
Siddle to Duminy, no run good length on the off stump and moved back in, Duminy shouldered his arms to that one
McDonald to Harris, no run fullish outside off, left alone to the keeper
McDonald to Harris, no run short of a length outside off, held its line, left alone
McDonald to Harris, no run fuller but maitaining an outside the off stump line, left alone
McDonald to Kallis, no run good length on the off stump, defended off the front foot toward cover
Siddle to Duminy, no run beaten, Siddle bowls it full on the off stump, angling into Duminy and moves away just as he tries to defend off the front foot
Siddle to Duminy, no run short of a good length outside off, left alone, held its line there
Siddle to Duminy, no run back of a length again, though it came in it was still wide enough for Duminy to let it go
Siddle to Duminy, no run short of a good length on the off stump, defended with a closed face on the leg side
Siddle to Duminy, no run full on the off stump, an inswinging yorker, dug out to point
Siddle to Duminy, no run fuller outside off and moved back in, left alone
McDonald to Morkel, no run good length pitching a fraction outside leg stump and moving into the left hander, tries to work it away in front of square, is hit on the pads
McDonald to Morkel, 2 runs turned away off the front foot wide of midwicket for two runs
McDonald to Steyn, no run yorker length on middle, digs it out well, playing it behind square
McDonald to Steyn, no run full outside off, gets forward and drives it uppishly towards cover
McDonald to Steyn, no run wristy, full on the pads and turned away to square leg
Siddle to Duminy, no run Duminy is in form, full outside off, driven straight to cover
Siddle to Duminy, 1 run fullish on middle and leg, driven off the front foot straight to midwicket
Siddle to Steyn, no run good length on middle and off, defended into the leg side

Siddle to Steyn, FOUR runs almost bowled him, full on middle and he drives through the line, just drives through the line but gets the inside edge to just evade the leg stump, they call that a french cut in China
Siddle to Steyn, no run short of a good length outside off, left alone to the keeper
Siddle to Steyn, 1 leg bye well played by Steyn, short on leg stump, fends it away but uses his arm guard and not his gloves like the ones who preceded him
McDonald to Steyn, no run short of a good length outside off, tries to defend it off the back foot, gets a thick edge towards gully
McDonald to Steyn, 4 byes inching towards the follow-on target, with a lot of luck, good length outside off and came back in, Steyn, who was into the drive missed it and so did the keeper
McDonald to Steyn, no run on middle and leg, pushes it off the front foot to mid-on
McDonald to Steyn, no run short of a good length outside off, left alone
McDonald to Steyn, no run full outside off and draws him into the drive, moves away just a touch to beat the outside edge
McDonald to Steyn, no run swinging in this time, fuller on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
Johnson to Duminy, 2 runs short of a good length on the off stump, punched off the back foot wide of cover
Johnson to Duminy, no run shortish outside off again, left alone
Johnson to Duminy, no run good length outside off and jagged back in, Duminy watched it through to the keeper
Johnson to Duminy, 2 runs swinging into the pads, driven off the front foot through the midwicket region for a couple
Johnson to Duminy, no run had him in a spot of bother there, good length outside off and nipped back in to hit Duminy right on the wrong spot, thank god for the protection
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a length outside off, tries to cut it between gully and point, almost ends up chopping it down onto the stumps, lucky
McDonald to Steyn, no run landed on a good length outside off and moved away just a touch, prodded at it, got the outside edge but fell well short of first slip
McDonald to Steyn, no run full on middle and leg, pushed through the line to mid-on
McDonald to Steyn, no run swinging back in, tries to work it away on the leg side, gets a faint edge onto the pads, the Australians go up but tone down once Bowden shakes his head
McDonald to Steyn, 2 runs full on middle, flicked away through the square-leg region for a couple
McDonald to Steyn, no run Steyn the batsman gets a stride forward and square drives it to point, stylishly played
McDonald to Steyn, no run full on middle and leg, driven firmly but straight to mid-on
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a good length on middle, defends it off the back foot on the leg side
Johnson to Duminy, 1 leg bye full on the pads, tries to flick it away behind square, is hit on the pads
Johnson to Steyn, no run full on the off stump with that round-arm action, Sten deals with it well, pushed it to mid-on
Johnson to Steyn, no run yorker on the off stump, dug out to mid-on
Johnson to Steyn, no run bouncer banged in short on middle, he ducks under it well
Johnson to Steyn, no run finally gets it right, good length on the off stump, defended to cover off the back foot
McDonald to Duminy, no run full on the off stump, defended to cover

McDonald to Duminy, no run refferal, seemed to land on a good length just a fraction outside leg to come back into the left hander, who tries to work it away fine but is rapped on the pads. Replays confrm just that, a waste of a referral if you ask me
McDonald to Duminy, 2 runs full on middle and leg, flicked away behind square for a couple
McDonald to Duminy, no run full outside off, steered to point
McDonald to Duminy, no run short of a length on middle, gets on the back foot to midwicket
McDonald to Duminy, FOUR runs excellent stuff, just a fraction short outside off, dabbed wide of slip, there's no third man and he deservedly gets a boundary
Johnson to Steyn, 1 run Sten the batsman works this short one behind square towards fine leg for a single
Johnson to Duminy, no run back of a length on middle, defended off the back foot to the bowler
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a good length outside off, chops it down towards cover
Johnson to Duminy, no run inswinger targeting middle, Duminy drives it uppishly to mid-on
Johnson to Duminy, no run short of a good length outside off, moved away after pitching but harmless in the end as Duminy is not made to play at it
Johnson to Duminy, no run full on the off stump, driven back to the bowler
McDonald to Steyn, no run stump-to-stump, Steyn gets back on middle, driven to midwicket
McDonald to Steyn, no run full on middle and off, driven off the front foot to mid-on
McDonald to Steyn, no run ..and the pitch is keeping a little low, landed on a good length outside off, tries to slap it back to the bowler, misses and gets to the keeper on the second bounce
McDonald to Steyn, no run on middle and off, defended solidly into the off side
McDonald to Steyn, no run short on middle, presents the full face back to the bowler
McDonald to Steyn, no run beat him there, tempting line outside off and came back in to evade the outside edge as he tried to defend that off the back foot
Johnson to Duminy, no run back of a length on the off stump, defended to point
Johnson to Duminy, 4 leg byes crucial runs, angling down leg and it clips his pads on the way to the fine-leg boundary
Johnson to Duminy, 1 run short of a length on middle, gets on the back foot and tucks it behind square
Johnson to Steyn, no run full outside off and moving away, tries to play at it but fails to reach
Johnson to Steyn, 1 run straight on middle, pushed in front of square through midwicket for a single

Australia will bat on so no follow-on. They lead by 214, a massive one as they look to close out the series. It was all over before you could blink. Steyn flashed at a wide one and Ntini was trapped in front the following ball. Siddle will be on a hat-trick when he takes the new ball soon. It's been a superb turnaround by the Australians after they collapsed yesterday morning. They'll look to pile on the
